12.1. Custom Menu Options for Resources

_EM: Tim Reitz 08/01/2024: Thoughts on how to handle the custom menu options? 

![](data:image/png;base64,)

These open specific Wiki pages, configured in Silverloom Settings. This seems a bit confusing / cumbersom. 

The "View Handbook" option opens a special Handbook record (configured in Advanced | Configuration | Configure Handbook), which makes it a bit more confusing. 

Should we consider combining all of these under a "Custom Resources" (or similar) configuration record? 

Tim Reitz 08/01/2024: Note that the Program Participation Agreement printout includes the text from the Vehicle Guideline Sheet wiki page, so that's an extra layer to consider here.

_VA*: Tim Reitz 08/01/2024: Ellis is thinking to keep these 3 in the Wiki. A few things: 

[ ] Could add "(Wiki)" suffix on the menu options 

[ ] Could add an asterisk and a note on the Silvlerloom Settings page for the one included in the printout.

_Bruce: Tim Reitz 08/01/2024: Emailed the ZWA clients today about this (email: Question about resource links).

Tim Reitz 08/05/2024: Client replied with the following:

It has always been a bit foggy to me how wiki plays into the whole  scheme of matters. IE: The handbook does not appear to be part of wiki. I know how to update the handbook and the vehicles allowed list, but I still am confused about wiki in general.

  


I suspect the average user does not care if the documents such as truck weight chart are stored in wiki or Hong Kong or Timbuktu :-) I feel it would only add confusion to add more incidents of the term wiki on the standard user menu. They only care how to access what they need.

_EM: Tim Reitz 08/05/2024: Thoughts on what's the best approach considering these first two paragraphs? I'm guessing the WI client would feel the same way.

  


Maybe a bit of clarification could be had by adding "View" in front of Allowed Vehicles, Truck Weight Chart, and Vehicle Guideline Sheet, the same as it is for Handbook.

_EM: Tim Reitz 08/05/2024: Thoughts?

_VA: Tim Reitz 08/07/2024: let's add this. 

Tim Reitz 08/08/2024: Actually, this is now going to be configurable in the Label system switches.

  


Maybe "back of insurance card" should be preceded by the word "Print" because that is really the only reason an agent would go there.

_EM: Tim Reitz 08/05/2024: Thoughts?

_VA: Tim Reitz 08/07/2024: let's add this. 

Tim Reitz 08/08/2024: Noted.

  


I am not sure if the link to wiki should even be in that list. The only other reason to go into wiki from that level

would be to access "tutorial videos". It probably would be cleaner to have a direct link to 'Tutorial Videos" in that list instead.

_EM: Tim Reitz 08/05/2024: I think Thoughts on moving the Wiki menu option to the Admin menu instead of the main menu? 

Tim Reitz 08/06/2024: I'm inclined to do this (separate CR, or in this design?). 

_VA: Tim Reitz 08/07/2024: Let's move the Wiki to Admin. 

Tim Reitz 08/08/2024: Done.

  


Tim Reitz 08/05/2024: Regarding the Tutorial Videos menu option idea, I'm asking the client if he knows how much use those get at this point. I'm thinking that maybe it's not worth making those a permanent part of the system. 

Tim Reitz 08/06/2024: From email conversation, client seemed fine with not doing a special menu option for tutorials. 

  


Another thought is that WI would use exactly the same Allowed Vehicles list. But I doubt they would  use the Handbook as we are using it, because that has some items in it that apply only to PA. The truck weight chart is a PA document. I do not know if WI has a similar document. They would have a vehicle guideline sheet but it might be slightly different than we are using. There really is no difference in application but they may emphasize certain concerns differently. You probably should check with them for their thoughts on that matter.

_EM: Tim Reitz 08/05/2024: This raises the question of what to do for menu options that would be left blank / unlinked. Currently, if one of the Resource items in Settings is blank / unlinked, clicking the menu option gives the following:

![](data:image/png;base64,)

I think we'd want to have conditional visibility for the menu options??

_VA: Tim Reitz 08/07/2024: Let's change these all to be System Switches: 

[X] Add 10 System Switches: 

  * ResourceMenu01Label (plain text field) 
  * ResourceMenu01Page (drop list of all Wiki pages) 
  * ResourceMenu01Action (drop list of "View Page" / "Page to PDF" / "View Attached PDF") 
    * Note: If "Page to PDF" is selected, we should respect the new "Include Title in Export" checkbox on the Wiki page) 



[X] Remove the items from Silverloom Settings

[X] Update the spec for the menu options 

[X] Move the Handbook to this new approach 

[X] Remove the Handbook record & "Configure Handbook" menu option 

[X] Move the "Print Insurance Card (Back)" option to the top of the list under Resources

[ ] Other? 

  


_VA: Tim Reitz 08/07/2024: Write up a CORE CR for Wiki pages to add a checkbox for "Include Title in Export" checkbox to the left of Generate PDF.

Tim Reitz 08/08/2024: Done here: [[[IN10441](https://zch.apphosting.zone/Detail/Edit/2?RecordType=Incidents&NumberID=-10443&)]] - CORE - Wiki - Add "Include Title in Export" Checkbox
